comments.content: B states "Lightning page in Lightning Experience", it doesn't refer to VF for the second option
You can't override a button with Lightning Page. You can override it with a Lightning Component. Technically, VF page would work in lightning as well.

discussion.content: Why Can't B be correct , you can show VF pages in Lightning so I'm not sure why you would need both VF and Lightning component ?

choices.D: Override the Contact's Edit button with a Lightning page in Salesforce Classic and a Visualforce page in Lightning Experience.
choices.C: Override the Contact's Edit button with a Lightning component in Salesforce Classic and a Lightning component in Lightning Experience.
choices.A: Override the Contact's Edit button with a Visualforce page in Salesforce Classic and a Lightning component in Lightning Experience.
choices.B: Override the Contact's Edit button with a Visualforce page in Salesforce Classic and a Lightning page in Lightning Experience.

questions.question_text:
A developer must provide a custom user interface when users edit a Contact. Users must be able to use the interface in Salesforce Classic and Lightning
Experience.
What should the developer do to provide the custom user interface?

A developer is writing tests for a class and needs to insert records to validate functionality.
Which annotation method should be used to create records for every method in the test class?

choices.B: The first Account returned is assigned to myAccount.
choices.A: The variable, myAccount, is automatically cast to the List data type.
choices.C: The query fails and an error is written to the debug log.
choices.D: An unhandled exception is thrown and the code terminates.

discussion.content: 22:02:39:042 FATAL_ERROR System.QueryException: List has more than 1 row for assignment to SObject

Selected Answer: D
Badly worded but I'm sure D is correct.

Selected Answer: C
Query exception is thrown and the error is logged in debug log

questions.question_text:
A Visualforce page is required for displaying and editing Case records that includes both standard and custom functionality defined in an Apex class called myControllerExtension.
The Visualforce page should include which <apex:page> attribute(s) to correctly implement controller functionality?

comments.content:
A. controller= "Case" and extensions= "myControllerExtension"
B. extensions= "myControllerExtension"
C. controller= "myControllerExtension"
D. standardController= "Case" and extensions= "myControllerExtension"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.A: The Vendor records have existing values in the Account object.
choices.B: The Account object is included on a workflow on the Vendor object.
choices.D: The Vendor object must use a Master-Detail field for reporting.
choices.C: The Account records contain Vendor roll-up summary fields.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) uses a custom object called Vendor. The Vendor custom object has a Master-Detail relationship with the standard Account object.
Based on some internal discussions, the UC administrator tried to change the Master-Detail relationship to a Lookup relationship but was not able to do so.
What is a possible reason that this change was not permitted?
